tier_1_determinative.sexual_act_description: The victim stated that no force or violence was used by the appellant, and she went with him voluntarily. The appellant did nothing by force.
tier_1_determinative.absence_of_consent: The victim's statement under Section 164 Cr.P.C indicates she went with the appellant voluntarily to Assam and no molestation or rape was committed.

tier_2_material.aggravated_circumstances_of_rape: The case involves sections under the POCSO Act, indicating the victim was a minor, which constitutes an aggravated circumstance.
tier_2_material.victim_age: The victim is indicated to be a minor as the case involves sections of the POCSO Act.
tier_2_material.relationship_to_accused: The victim was enticed by the appellant, suggesting no prior relationship.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The victim went to Assam with the appellant and stayed at his grandfather's house for two days.
tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The victim returned on 15.8.2023, indicating the incident occurred before this date.
tier_3_contextual.time_of_reporting: The appellant was in jail since 23.8.2023, suggesting the report was made around that time.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Raka @ Rakesh Kumar vs State Of U.P. Thru. Prin. Secy. Home Lko. And 2 Others
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Allahabad, Lucknow Bench
tier_4_procedural.respondent: State Of U.P. Thru. Prin. Secy. Home Lko. And 2 Others

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellant was accused under Sections 363, 366, 376 IPC, 3/4 POCSO Act, and Sections 3(2)(V) SC/ST Act. The appeal was allowed, and the appellant was granted bail with conditions.
